column4: Connected my box to a Samsung TV. Samsung resolution is 1920x1080. I set the nVidia driver settings to auto detect and it recognizes the TV and the resolution; however, the X desktop is about 5% too big for the screen so I cannot see the top or bottom bars. How do i fix this?
in the user settings for nvidia you will find the correction slider for it, I think its in the 'tv' tab
xvidia setting? nice gui? fixes it
I suggested nvidia configuration app, nice gui that lets you fix the over-scan
I cannot find the "slider". Where should I be looking? What would it be named?
is the app open?
left side, lots of options, near bottom, something about the tv?
stop clicking on shit
cool, it opens another options list, yes?
second to last option is what?
http://www.ypass.net/blog/2010/04/nvidia-overscan-correction-fixed-in-latest-drivers/ <-- find that option
I just found that too. (I didn't know it was called overscan, which was vital to my Google Fu skills. )Which option on there do you recommend?
THE CIRCLED ONE!
using nvidia-current?
yes.
you have 'nvidia-current' installed, and don't see the slider, that's a mystery then
wait, its there, its hidden, can you move the window up?
wait, its there, its hidden, can you move the window up?
I cannot move it. There is only one slider (vibrance) and then Detect EDID is below that. Expanding the window downwards reveals nothing. I think I just need the newest driver.
I take that back. I CAN move it, but it doesn't reveal anything new. :-(
that's really strange, you can see the bottom borders?
Yep. See all the borders. What's strange is that if I click on ANYTHING that has to do with the TV (that "SAMSUNG" panel), the app crashes.
